column6: The only real antibacterial body wash. Read this for science and more.
column9: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2020
column14: So many things call themselves antibacterial these days, but this Dettol body wash is the real deal.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2018
column14: I have a medical condition that causes very heavy sweating.  My wife and daughter started commenting on how badly I needed a shower when I got home from work, which was disconcerting because I work very closely with both my employees and my customers.  I was scrubbing myself thoroughly with regular soap while showering twice a day, and it didn't seem to be making a dent in the body odor I developed at work.

column9: Reviewed in the United States on July 7, 2019
column14: My wife's grandmother from Antigua told me about this product and I tried it with my grandson who has severe eczema. This was the best product we've found to jumpstart a treatment for him. I noticed a difference the very next day. We've used it for a week and it has gotten progressively better every day. 10 stars!!

column6: No English directions or precautions. Beware
column9: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2019
column14: Well, I got my Dettol. The only problem, I hope it’s the only problem, the only things I recognize on the bottle are “Dettol” “original” “body wash”, “Dettol and the Sword Symbols are trademarks”. Everything else is in what I guess to be Indonesian or some Indian language. Can’t read directions or precautions. And I bought 4 bottles. Serves me right for not testing one bottle before stocking up. Buyers...Beware.
